bibl.title: Desposition of Thomas McKnight
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.

div1.p:
Paul Jones (a man of colour) vs. George W. Jones
District County for Grant County Wisconsin Territory September Term 1840 Desposition of Thomas M. Knight to be read in the above entitled cause taken on the application of the defendent &

1st interrogatory
Are you acquainted with the parties in the above case.
I am

2nd interrogatory are you acquainted with the matters in the differences between the parties in this suit.
I am.

3rd interrogatory. State all you know about it.
answer. I have always understoodfrom others & Plff alsothat Plff was an Illinois slave & belonged to Deft I know Plffs mother & she told me Plff was a slave. I employed Plff in the Deft in the winter summer of 1836 & winter following. Plff told witness that he owed Deft. two or three hundred dollars & wanted to pay him Plff wanted witness to write to Deft & inform him Plff on settlement for work which was about eighty dollars for which amount gave Plff an order on Deft for Plff. Witness thinks that Plff had not been in the service or employment of Deft since that time. Witness knows that Plff while in the service of Deft was not an industrious or valuable servant witness thinks that the situations & condition of Plff was better while in the service of Deft there since he left Deft's service

press interrogatory
How long have you been aquainted with Plff.
answer. Since the year 1829

2nd X interrogatory
Has Plff been in the employ of Deft since that time & how much long.
answer. Plff has been in the employ of Deft since 1829. four or five years

#rd X interrogatory
When was Plff in the employ of Deft during that time
answer In that part of the Territory of Michigan and his now called Wisconsin.

4th X interrogatory
Did you know Plff in Missouri & was he there in the employ of Deft.
answer. I know Plff. in Missouri & I do not know whether he was there in the employ of Deft or not but was living with our Mrs. Scott

5th X interrogatory Do you know what was the consideration of Plffs indebtedness to Dft
answer. Witness does not know exactly but thinks it was for the purchase of his freedom from Deft. Witness comes to this conclusion from the fact that he had been a slave of deft & was at work for himself but never heard it from either party

6th X interrogatory was Plff while in the service of Deft as valuable a servent as he was while in your service
answer. Witness thinks Plff was not as valuable a servient while in the service of Deft as he was while in the service of witness & he did not earn while in witness's service the amount witness paid him Plff.
4th interrogatory. Do you know of Plff working as a smelting foreman for Deft if so how long
answer. Plff I do know of Plff working in attending to Deft as a foreman but does not know how long

8th interrogatory Do you know how Plff's situation & condition was better which in Defts service than since that time
answer. Plff was better fed and better clothed while Deft's service than since he left deft's service & was not under much restraint while in deft's service & appeared to act as he pleased. Witness has known Plff since he left Deft's service two years in what is now called Iowa Territory & while he has lived in this Territory Plff was working off & on for witness while he Plff lived in sd Iowa Territory & was under witness direction all the time Plff lived in what is now called Iowa Territory

Questions by Deft
1st interrogatory Do you know of Plff being indebted to Deft on other accounts than for the purchase of his freedom
answer. I do know of Plff being indebted to Deft for goods sold & delivered by Deft to Plff. Exact amount witness does not know. Witness knows of plff getting of Deft at one time this time of fourteen dollars in goods a fiddle and in addition told witness he owed Deft for some other things.
2nd. Do you know whether Pff Deft has been engaged in business in the State of Missouri since he purhcased the Plff a a slave.
Witness thinks that p Deft has not been engaged in business, since he purchased Def Plff in Missouri.

Cross interrogatory
How much did What was the price of labourers while Deft Plff was in your employ & how much did you pay Plff
answer. I paid Plff twenty dollars per month and I paid some other labors forty five dollars per month ---- & while Plff was in Defts service the price of labourers was from twelve to twenty dollars per month. Th M. Knight
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 3rd day of October 1840 NEL Dewey Justice of the peace

Territory of Wisconsin County of Grant Ss I Nelson Dewey a Justice of the peace of Said country do here by certify that the agreement of the parties in the above entitled cause all objections & information in the service of noting & in taking the foregoing depositions of Thomas Mc Knight are & they are to be read the summon as if all the formalities of law had been complied with in taking & certifying the same & I am to deliver the same to the court unsealed.

Witness my hand this 3th day of Oct 1840
NEL Dewey Jus peace

Paul Jones a man of color vs George W Jones
deposition of Thomas McKnight
